newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Friday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover rose to 3.859 billion yuan from 2.517 billion yuan on Thursday and the seven-day contract was the most active.
Traders said the active domestic A share market and several new issues and listings remained as the key supports for the market while state banks cut their trading today.
There were four new issues and two listings on the A share markets in Shanghai and Shenzhen.
But the expectation of a cut in bank reserve ratios since April has prevented the rates from rising, local traders said.

Traders said that some non-banking financial institutions, encouraged by the A shares, were still significant buyers while some short-term financial centres such as Beijing remained the most active sellers.
